definition: khan (loanword)
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]

sentences.english: Khan was a ruler under a well-developed regime in North Asia from the 4 th century on.
sentences.chinese: 可汗是四世紀以後北亞民族高級政治體首領的稱謂。

sentences.english: Che Khan, ruler of the Khans, orders the assassination of the newborn baby of the Maraji s.
sentences.chinese: 汗國的統治者車可汗下令暗殺這個馬拉吉家的新生兒。

sentences.english: Students ages 5 to 15 attend the experimental Khan Lab School.
sentences.chinese: 可汗實驗學校招收的學生年齡在5歲到15歲之間。

sentences.english: Certainly, the new great khan would have good cause to reassess Mongol strategy.
sentences.chinese: 誠然，新大可汗有足夠的理由重新評估蒙古戰略。

sentences.english: Khan and the Mongolian Kings times khanates of tent accommodation 2000.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古汗國時代可汗及諸王的帳幕可容2000人。

sentences.english: Shiwan Khan needs a beryllium sphere to complete the bomb.
sentences.chinese: 史完可汗需要一個鈹球來做炸彈。

sentences.english: He, in turn, was vassal to the Great Khan of China.
sentences.chinese: 而他，僅僅是中國大可汗的一個大臣而已。

sentences.english: Pioneers like Sal Khan are already showing how effective online tools can be.
sentences.chinese: 像開拓者薩爾可汗已經展示了在線工具的高效率。

sentences.english: The Khans had come a long way in just a few decades.
sentences.chinese: 可汗在短短几十年裏一直在長途跋涉。

sentences.english: He is too emotional. He may offend the Khitan Khan.
sentences.chinese: 他容易衝動，會得罪契丹可汗。

sentences.english: The famed Kublai khan ruled his empire from a palace here.
sentences.chinese: 著名的忽必烈可汗就是在這建立他的王朝。

sentences.english: A win over Khan is good, but not enough to get him a Pacquiao fight.
sentences.chinese: 贏了可汗是好事兒，但要與帕奎奧比賽條件還不夠。

definition: Turkic ethnic group
chanyu (Han Dynasty name for chiefs of Xiongnu Huns 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2])
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
profuse perspiration
supreme khan
khanate (Mongol state)
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Temujin, birth name of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2]
Bayan (name)/Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239/Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)
tent of the commanding officer/tent capital of a nomadic people
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
(hist.) title of the Tibetan Tufan ruler
